thread.title: Floyd Mayweather on latest Conor McGregor fight rumors: 'I'm happily retired'
thread.title_full: Floyd Mayweather on latest Conor McGregor fight rumors: 'I'm happily retired'

author: Brandon Schlager (bschlager@sportingnews.com)
title: Floyd Mayweather on latest Conor McGregor fight rumors: 'I'm happily retired'
text:
February 14, 2017 7:09pm EST February 14, 2017 7:09pm EST News, Boxing, English, Floyd Mayweather Jr The retired boxer is pumping the brakes on months of teasing a megafight with Conor McGregor as another round of rumors swirl. Floyd Mayweather Jr. (Getty Images) 
Updated at 7:09 p.m. ET 
Updated at 7:09 p.m. ET 
Floyd Mayweather Jr. is pumping the brakes on months of teasing a megafight with Conor McGregor as another round of rumors swirl. 
Irish tabloid The Sun reported early Tuesday the sides had agreed to "a multimillion dollar deal" to green light the first-of-its-kind event, which would pit the boxing legend against one of mixed martial art's most accomplished fighters in a cross-trade bout. Yahoo Sports and other outlets quickly refuted the report. 
MORE: Floyd Mayweather vs. Conor McGregor: We're not sure who to believe anymore 
Mayweather, retired since 2015, responded later Tuesday to throw more cold water on renewed hype over the fight. 
"There seems to be several rumors floating around media recently," he wrote on Twitter . "However, let the record show, there hasn't been any deals made in regards to a fight between myself and any other fighters. I am happily retired and enjoying life at this time. If any changes are to come, be sure that I will be the first to let the world to know." Read This
